abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Multi Donor Trust Fund
            (MDTF) South Sudan Private Sector Development Project for
            South Sudan were as follows outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate; bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory; grantee performance
            was moderately satisfactory. There are some of the key
            lessons learned from this project (i) projects designed in
            post-conflicts regions need a heavy dose of realism; (ii)
            constant supervision is indispensable and resources ought to
            be organized accordingly; (iii) the costs and difficulties
            of attracting and retaining qualified personnel are
            considerable;(iv) M&E systems should be established and
            funded before others; (v) high-level steering committees are
            key;(vi)world bank procedures must be capable of responding
            to post-conflict environments. The development objectives of
            the project were to: (A) develop an enabling environment for
            private sector growth; and (B) to sustainably increase
            formal employment in Southern Sudan
